stream_context.summary: Kaze live-iterates on Course 15, scraps the original “space arcade” concept after extensive critique, and re-imagines it as a 1950s retro-futurist Shy Guy space-station (“Sky Guy Station”) with a visible bioluminescent space-squid boss that gates the rest of the level. He confirms the RTYI public-demo is complete but blocked by a Parallel Launcher bug and reiterates a 30 FPS hardware target. The session is mainly high-level design discussion, with brief technical notes and shout-outs to team members.

development_findings.summary: RTYI public demo is finished but cannot release because a Parallel Launcher bug prevents the ROM from booting.
development_findings.quote: The RTYI demo is finished now, but there is a bug in Parallel Launcher that makes my ROM not boot.

development_findings.summary: Course 15’s initial “space arcade” idea is officially discarded; the new theme is a Shy Guy space colony called Sky Guy Station, inspired by 1950s retro-futurism and Sonic Adventure’s Space Colony ARK.
development_findings.quote: I think we need to abandon the arcade idea and go for a space colony… a Shy Guy space civilization in space also adds a lot of placeness.

development_findings.summary: Level structure: player first sees a giant bioluminescent space-squid boss; defeating it unlocks three previously inaccessible areas (crop plantation, water storage bubbles, Shy Guy rocket). Visible objectives create guidance without linearity.
development_findings.quote: There will be houses all around… you can perceive all three of the normal stars but not enter them until they've beaten the squid.

development_findings.summary: Design goals: maximise ‘placeness’, keep Mario readable (dark carpets, avoid glowing walkable floors), start broad then refine, avoid arbitrary retro minigames that break Mario 64 gameplay.
development_findings.quote: You have to go from the broadest thing down to the finest detail… no matter how we implement the arcade theme it's not gonna be fun.

development_findings.summary: Technical targets: 30 FPS on real N64 hardware; 60 is ‘unreasonable’. Custom camera system already in place; fast sine/cos still included but less critical.
development_findings.quote: We are going for 30 on console. 60 on console is just unreasonable.

development_findings.summary: Prototyped steel-beam octagon ring gives structure but Kaze plans added verticality, taxis, black-hole warps, and instant-warp tricks to increase perceived scale without exceeding hardware limits.
Retro secret area for this course will parody Mario 64 itself (pixel-art aesthetic) because other classic games are exhausted.
development_findings.quote: The retro area on this level is going to be Mario 64-themed… 'oh my god, it looked that different'.

development_findings.summary: Entire overworld will let players explore every square inch of Yoshi’s Island, with 6–9 secret levels and more overworld stars to surpass Star Road’s hub depth.
development_findings.quote: The overworld will be the entirety of Yoshi's Island… hopefully it’s gonna feel a lot more elaborate than R64's overworld.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s core philosophy is ‘form follows function’ and ruthlessly cutting ideas that lack ‘placeness’ or fun.
context_findings.quote: If this concept sucks, we scrap it. I think the problem is we’re pushing the arcade theme too much.

context_findings.summary: He dislikes one-on-one tech support because it is time-consuming and frustrating.
context_findings.quote: I don't mind helping people, but one-to-one conversations where I'm expected to help and answer questions—I find that very frustrating.

context_findings.summary: Kaze reinvests donations into paying collaborators and has ‘crazy plans’ to monetise the hack legally.
context_findings.quote: I do put a lot of the money I get donated back into the game… I actually have crazy plans to maybe, hopefully, somehow monetise this game.

context_findings.summary: Maintains day-job at Gears for Breakfast, limiting dev time.
context_findings.quote: I do still work for Gears for Breakfast, yeah. Takes a lot of my time.

context_findings.summary: Emotional arc: visible frustration with current level (‘looks like ass’), excitement after pivot (‘now I’m much more happy with how this level is going’).

biobak.summary: Implemented dynamic sun texture that rotates with camera pitch; Kaze praises the visual effect.
biobak.quote: You see the sun there, how it moves? It's a Biobak idea, but it's so good.

biobak.summary: Will be paid from donation funds and any future monetisation.

badub.summary: Confirmed as main composer; music hosted on SoundCloud; Kaze may buy rights for physical release.
badub.quote: I would have to pay Badub out for the rights to the music or something.

key_stories.title: Scrapping the Space Arcade
key_stories.summary: Kaze begins the stream trying to salvage a ‘space arcade’ level but realises the theme lacks structure and fun. After reviewing reference images and community feedback, he decides to scrap the idea.
key_stories.challenge: Level felt random, ugly, and lacked ‘placeness’; arcade minigame concepts weren’t fun.
key_stories.process: Critiqued glowing carpets, staircases, and arcade machines; explored references; debated platforming flow; considered gravity zones and ring structures.
key_stories.outcome: Official pivot to a Shy Guy space colony theme with clearer objectives and stronger identity.
key_stories.key_quote: No matter how we implement the arcade theme, it's not gonna be fun.

key_stories.title: Birth of Sky Guy Station
key_stories.summary: Following the arcade rejection, Kaze rapidly prototypes a new narrative: a retro-futurist Shy Guy space settlement where a giant space squid terrorises the inhabitants.
key_stories.challenge: Need a compelling, cohesive theme that provides visual identity and gameplay hooks.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed 1950s tech aesthetics, Shy Guy houses, propaganda TVs, taxis, crop domes, and water bubbles; mapped star flow on-stream.
key_stories.outcome: Solid high-level plan: squid boss gates three main stars, visible landmarks guide players, level renamed ‘Sky Guy Station’.
key_stories.key_quote: A Shy Guy space civilization in space also adds a lot of placeness to it.

key_stories.title: Demo Ready, Launcher Broken
key_stories.summary: Kaze reveals the RTYI demo is complete but an external launcher bug prevents release.
key_stories.challenge: Parallel Launcher fails to boot the ROM.
key_stories.process: Coordinating with the launcher maintainer to debug.
key_stories.outcome: Demo release delayed; Kaze plans a quiet drop once fixed.
key_stories.key_quote: The demo is finished, but there is a bug in Parallel Launcher that makes my ROM not boot.
